person.persName: David Rice Haggard (Colonel of the 5th Kentucky Cavalry; Cumberland County, Kentucky Physician and farmer)

body.p: A Kentucky physician, farmer, businessman, and soldier. Lived in Cumberland County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Jane M. Haggard. Father of Ben Rice Haggard, Thomas P. Haggard, Henry B. Haggard, Mary B. Haggard, Clarence R. Haggard, and Irene S. Haggard. Owned five enslaves persons in 1850 and severn in 1860. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives from 1844 to 1847. Served as colonel of the 5th Kentucky Cavalry from January 1862 to February 1863. Served as president of the Indian Creek and Jack's Knob, Iron, Coal, Salt, Lead, Lumber, Oil, and Manufacturing Company in 1865.
